p: We identified 15 antibiotics for which there had been a referral procedure during the study period 2007 to 2020, representing seven classes of antibiotics ( Table 1, Supplementary table S1). Four referrals related to cephalosporins, three to penicillins, two each to fluoroquinolones, carbapenems and glycopeptide and one each to polymyxins and other antibacterial medicines. Most of the regulatory actions (n = 12) were Article 30 Directive 2001/83/EC and only three were Article 31 of Directive 2001/83/EC. Only four referral procedures were triggered by a Member State (France, Germany, the Netherlands and Spain), others (n = 11) were initiated by the EC.
